page.title: 02Darras Hall Estate
page.content: In{1907,}1014 acres of wet-land were purchased by the Northern Allotment Society in the{Darras Hall}area containing 3 farm houses(all of which still stand).By 1911 the land was divided into lots and roads were laid out to form the beginnings of a garden town.The estate has grown steadily over the years and now contains more than 2000 properties,most of which, under the{Darras Hall Trust Deed,}have gardens of at least a quarter of an acre. Each family pays an annual rent charge (Â£5 in 1985). This pays for office accommodation on the estate for a secretary and administrative officer and an elected committee of residents looks after the interests of the estate, keeping residents informed about local happenings by means of a newsletter.
